page.title: 19CUSTOMS. WELL DRESSINGS
page.content: The actual dressing has to be done in a week, but we start before this.The clay for the backing is dug and put in the river in sacks, to soften a week before we start. On Friday night it is thrown on to the board to make it stick, smoothed and left to stand over night. Next day work starts. A pattern is laid on the clay, and prickd through to mark the picture into the clay. The picture is then marked in with wool. This can take one or two days. Then the 'filling in' starts. First non-perishable items are put in, gravel, lichen, etc. Then the seeds, mosses, twigs and longer lasting plants are added. The petals are added last, Wed. Thurs. and Fri. because they will not last long. The wells are erected on Saturday morning.Six wells are dressed.
